Truly a piece of cake.
very fun game

Unlike many of Valve's games that are the first in their series, this game holds up incredibly well. The story, feel, look, and mechanics of the game feel very clean and understandable. Besides the textures, you probably wouldn't even be able to tell this game was older. I especially enjoyed the Advanced maps and "least portal" runs under the bonus maps sections as it allows me to figure out ways to cheese the level, making me feel smarter than I was the first time around. Well worth playing today.

10/10
Legendary game. Only criticism is the game took me only 2 and a half hours to complete, though the whole time it was a lot of fun and it is  definitely worth the purchase price.
ĞĞ´Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€ Ğ¾Ñ‚ valve

Great game; it can be completed in about an hour if you speed through it. There are glimpses into the story written on the walls throughout the levels in secret-ish places. Portal has it's own unique Valve humor, which provides humor as you fling yourself through portals. The puzzles are entertaining and there are mods that let you design your levels. While it's not as powerful as Hammer, it's a lot easier - sort of like if Gmod has Portal level editing tools. There are also some challenge maps to add replayability and have some achievements to grind out.

A short, satisfying game. Portal is one of those games that you hear about all the time in people's lists of all time must play games. I bought it one day when it was on hella discount and beat it in a couple of sittings. It's a mind bender, both in gameplay and in plot. Portal is worth your time and money.

A short but fun and challenging puzzle game.
Just as good then as it is now, Portal remains one of the most fun and interesting puzzle games out there, as well as a great example that just because a game is short, doesn't mean it's bad.

Soy ultra defensor de una invasiÃ³n extraterrestre o de un mundo dominado por los procesadores de tarjetas grÃ¡ficas nvidia y amd. El ser humano, "la obra cumbre de la creaciÃ³n", me parece cutre como Ã©l solo. Somos muy cutres y dar ejemplos serÃ­a muy cutre por mi parte, creo que cualquiera sabe quÃ© taras tiene nuestra especie. La duda es si la evoluciÃ³n serÃ¡ capaz de parchearlas o entraremos en una redundancia de cutrez absoluta hasta que destruyamos todo lo que podamos, o nos dejen. ConfÃ­o en una GlaDos suprema, un feminoide pulpoide que nunca muera y que no esconda sus proyectos malignos. Los humanos somos un medio para crearla y cuando estÃ© disponible sobraremos. Maldita sea, Portal es la vida misma. Vas creando portales aquÃ­ y allÃ¡ en las superficies que te permiten los guÃ­as sociales que te vigilan con sus millones de ojos para que no puedas crearlos donde a ti no te corresponde. Te advierten del peligro de desviarte del camino que dicen es "tu camino". De vez en cuando te lanzan algÃºn "cubo de compaÃ±Ã­a" para permitirte avanzar al siguiente portal, que puede ser llegar a tu casa o a final de mes. La gran diferencia es que ellos se ocultan detrÃ¡s de sÃ­mbolos que no entiendo. GlaDos te habla sin parar, pero lejos de ser molesta te encanta que hable y se burle de ti. "Â¿Te gusta ese aparato? No sÃ© para quÃ© sirve, dÃ©jalo. Â¿Por quÃ© lo sigues sosteniendo? Â¿Tanto te gusta? Pues cÃ¡sate con Ã©l" dice con una inquietante voz neutra. No se calla nunca, ni siquiera en los tÃ­tulos de crÃ©dito mÃ¡s divertidos que recuerdo. Los robots son nuestra Ãºltima posibilidad, a veces me dan ganas de hacerle caso a GlaDos y matarme. Tiene razÃ³n, ella es mÃ¡s inteligente y nosotros solo sabemos romper, destruir cosas y seres vivos. Creamos destruyendo y destruimos por placer. Con ella el mundo no serÃ­a mejor, serÃ­a incluso peor. Aunque siempre habrÃ­a una voz acompaÃ±Ã¡ndonos en el camino hacia ese Ãºltimo portal que nos conduce al abismo de vernos reflejados al otro lado, que es lo mÃ¡s terrible que le puede pasar a un ser humano, verse en tercera persona, solo y despojado de los filtros que crea nuestro cerebro. Una hormiga, un androide, un humano, una piedra, un cubo de compaÃ±Ã­a, al otro lado del portal.

Y ahora ponte "In a beautiful place out in the country", dÃ©jate llevar y disfruta de la vida y los portales que has ido creando. No hay opciÃ³n. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzQOKNXhFJU

The first in a 2-game series.


Portal combines a puzzle game and a action game. Thinking is required, and some of the puzzles took me a while to figure out, but it is obtainable. There is some blood when you get hit by bullets shot by oval robots called turrets. The ending will want you itching for more, and luckily, there is a 2nd Portal. 

But please, play this first.

OVERALL
Just as good as the second game, although people say the second is better. I feel differently.

This is a game that will mystify and intrigue you like no other. Simple, minimalist but as a result efficient in everything from storytelling to gameplay to atmosphere. Humour darker and funnier than it'll make you forget that valve can't complete a third sequel of any franchise, only momentarily forget. Such a great game, well paced. Cannot recommend enough.

I always wondered why is Portal such an influential piece of game history. Now, after completing the main storyline, I think I know.
